No terms were disclosed, but the portfolio comprises about 20 investments in renewable energy, contract natural gas fired generation and midstream energy infrastructure assets, mostly in the U.S., Apollo said in a statement.
Funds managed by Apollo Global Management LLC APO, -2.43% have agreed to acquire a portfolio of equity investments worth about $1 billion from GE Capital's GE, -4.63% energy financial services unit.
Ge shares rose 2.8% premarket on the news, but are down 24.5% in 2018, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% has gained 8%.
The deal is expected to close in the fourth quarter and may be followed by further deals between the parties.
